DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time Assessment Upper Limit of Normal Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values for a procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood in a laboratory setting related to activated partial thromboplastin time, which is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Activated Partial Thromboplastin Time Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood in a laboratory setting related to activated partial thromboplastin time, which is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: To cause something to start; stimulation of activity.:This is a measurement of the intrinsic pathway of coagulation. Significant deficiency in factors II, V, VIII, IX, X, XI, XII or anticoagulants will prolong PTT.:Having determined the value, significance, or extent of.

Concepts.definition: To cause something to start or to stimulate activity.

A measurement of the length of time that it takes for clotting to occur when activating reagents are added to a plasma specimen. The test is partial due to the absence of tissue factor (Factor III) from the reaction mixture.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Changed from CTEP to Alliance for by script Fri Oct 25 15:25:44 EDT 2013

ValueDomain.preferredName: Hematology Partial Thromboplastin Time Lab Upper Limit of Normal Value
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a numeric laboratory value representing the upper level of the normal range of values for partial thromboplastin time in peripheral blood used to comparatively reference the patient's lab result.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: The top value of the range of statistical characteristics that are supposed to represent accepted standard, non-pathological pattern for particular laboratory result or other quantitative parameter.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ValueDomain.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form
